001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.lines;
002
003import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
004
005public abstract class Utils {
006        
007        /**
008         * This is a brute-force drawing method which simply marks all image pixels that
009         * are sufficiently close to the HoughLine hl. The drawing color for ip must be
010         * previously set.
011         *  @param line the line to be drawn.
012         * @param ip the {@link ImageProcessor} instance to draw to.
013         * @param thickness the thickness of the lines to be drawn.
014         */
015        public static void draw(AlgebraicLine line, ImageProcessor ip, double thickness) {
016                final int w = ip.getWidth();
017                final int h = ip.getHeight();
018                final double dmax = 0.5 * thickness;
019                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
020                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
021                                // get the distance between (u,v) and the line hl:
022                                double d = Math.abs(line.getDistance(u, v));
023                                if (d <= dmax) {
024                                        ip.drawPixel(u, v);
025                                }
026                        }
027                }
028        }
029        
030
031}
